column3: Could someone advise why the new subtree would not be visible to the Travis build?\nI don't have a problem building and testing this locally.
Why use CSV?\nWe already have an internal JSON parser (UniValue) or a flexible configuration file reader...

I would like to include some more improvement commits based on code review feedback I received so far (on code parts which are common to https://github.com/BitcoinUnlimited/BitcoinUnlimited/pull/458) .\n\nI'll keep these as separate commits on top of this branch for now, for easier separate review of these additional changes.

Changing this to [WIP] ahead of a rebasing which will contain GetStateStatisticsFor() from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/557c9a68fb72aeb535f2efe3cc82d3f5e66c6ad3 which needs to be checked, maybe it requires further adaptation to BIP135 .
Rebased.\n\nThe review comments addressing the "Modifiable" functions are still work in progress, as is revising the BIP9 statistics that were introduced by the rebase.
Going to close this PR for now. It needs a large rebase, and hasn't generated much discussion.
why not use CreateChainParams?\nwhen are the chainparams created here destroyed?
this kind of thing can be done separately
NACK both this method and ModifiableParams, neither of them should be needed.
I agree, this can probably be improved by re-using existing code.\nWill look into that - I'm not so familiar with the recent Core code and so used some methods from existing implementation.
Agreed - will remove.\nI might have wanted to set these to known values for debugging purposes.
I have a habit of updating the copyright dates whenever I modify a file.\nWhat do you mean by done separately - should I not update them, or rather do it in a separate commit?
You're right, this function should not be needed and I will re-use CreateChainParams.\nThe params created in Params() are not explicitly destroyed.
